TEXT.English: [TAB]Archosian spiders have hidden nationality, meaning they can enter other players territory and attack without declaring war, and excel at denying exploration and expansion of other civs. But, contrarily to units with [LINK=PROMOTION_HIDDEN_NATIONALITY]hidden nationality promotion[\LINK], they can't [LINK=SPELL_DECLARE_NATIONALITY]reveal their nationality[\LINK] and hence can't capture cities. [PARAGRAPH:2]Archosian spiders are acquired by spending a currency unique to Archos: Brood Activity (BA), which is accumulated each turn. You can get more BA per turn by increasing capital population, acquiring more diverse meat resources and building more [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_FEEDING_PEN]Feeding Pens[\LINK] and [LINK=BUILDING_DARK_WEALD]Dark Wealds[\LINK]. Spiders also produce 5 BA from each combat (win or lose), so do use them aggressively. The initial size of spiders is limited by the population of the city you are trying to spawn it from: [LINK=SPELL_CALL_BABY_SPIDER]baby spiders[\LINK] (25 BA) are always available, [LINK=SPELL_CALL_SPIDER]adult spiders[\LINK] (75 BA) require size 8+, and [LINK=SPELL_CALL_GIANT_SPIDER]giant spiders[\LINK] (200 BA) require size 16+. [PARAGRAPH:2]If you save up enough BA, you will also start to get passive spider spawns, with the spawn rate being proportional to the BA gained per turn: [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][TAB]000-199 BA (Dormant): No spawns [NEWLINE][TAB]200-499 BA (Astir): [LINK=UNIT_BABY_SPIDER]Baby Spider[\LINK] spawns [NEWLINE][TAB]500-999 BA (Restless) and capital size 8+: [LINK=UNIT_SPIDER]Adult Spider[\LINK] spawns [NEWLINE][TAB]1000+ BA (Thronging) and capital size 16+: [LINK=UNIT_GIANT_SPIDER]Giant Spider[\LINK] spawns [PARAGRAPH:2]Additionally, you'll want to save a couple of early spiders once they reach levels 4, 5, 6 and 7 to be devoured by Mother at your capital in order to create [LINK=BUILDING_ARCHOS_NEST_ADDON1]Broodchambers[\LINK]; while it might feel a waste of a perfectly good leveled spider, it'll help make all of your other spawned spiders in mid and late game match up to the strength of stronger units, keeping you competitive. [PARAGRAPH:2]Although spawned baby spiders are free, adult spiders and giant spiders cost gold to maintain and can be a strain on your economy. This can be remedied by promoting your spiders to [LINK=PROMOTION_SPIDER_TEXTUS_GREATER]Greater Weaver[\LINK] so that they can construct a [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_NESTING_GROUND]Nesting Ground[\LINK], or capturing a fortress and turning it into an [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_INFESTED_FORTRESS]Infested Fortress[\LINK]. When resting inside these fortifications, spiders do not cost any maintenance. [PARAGRAPH:2]If you still find yourself with too many spiders, Archosian spell casters also have access to the unique [LINK=PROMOTION_ARACHNOMANCY1]Arachnomancy[\LINK] line of spells, which sacrifices spiders for various effects.

TEXT.English: After defeating (and eating) a living unit in battle, baby spider gains the [LINK=PROMOTION_GROWTH_SPURTS]Growth spurts[\LINK] promotion, transforming it into an [LINK=UNIT_SPIDER]adult spider[\LINK] with a probability of 20% per turn. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Baby Spiders are very weak individually, but the Archos civilization can make use of them by [LINK=SPELL_SMEAR_POISON]sacrificing[\LINK] them for poisoned weapons or [LINK=SPELL_CANNIBALIZE]feeding[\LINK] them to bigger spiders for healing. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Additionally, baby spiders grow stronger when large numbers of them are grouped together, gaining one stack of the [LINK=PROMOTION_SWARMING1]Swarming[\LINK] promotion for every 10 baby spiders in the same tile, up to 4 stacks.

TEXT.English: From level 3, Spiders can choose 1 color among 5 possibilities:[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][TAB][ICON_BULLET]Blue (Diver; [LINK=PROMOTION_SPIDER_ARGYRONETA]Argyroneta[\LINK]).[NEWLINE][TAB][ICON_BULLET]Green (Spitter; [LINK=PROMOTION_SPIDER_VENENUM]Venenum[\LINK]).[NEWLINE][TAB][ICON_BULLET]Grey (Burrower; [LINK=PROMOTION_SPIDER_MUCRO]Mucro[\LINK]).[NEWLINE][TAB][ICON_BULLET]Red (Exploder; [LINK=PROMOTION_SPIDER_RHAGODESSA]Rhagodessa[\LINK]).[NEWLINE][TAB][ICON_BULLET]Yellow (Weaver; [LINK=PROMOTION_SPIDER_TEXTUS]Textus[\LINK]). [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Archosian Spiders can be [LINK=SPELL_SPIDER_ARCHOS]upgraded[\LINK] to [LINK=UNIT_GIANT_SPIDER]Giant Spiders[\LINK] once they reach level 4 and the Archosian capital has 8+ population.

TEXT.English: Giant Spiders can evolve along their color variant for even more powerful abilities:[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][TAB][ICON_BULLET]Blue (Greater Diver; [LINK=PROMOTION_SPIDER_ARGYRONETA_GREATER]Greater Argyroneta[\LINK]).[NEWLINE][TAB][ICON_BULLET]Green (Greater Spitter; [LINK=PROMOTION_SPIDER_VENENUM_GREATER]Greater Venenum[\LINK]).[NEWLINE][TAB][ICON_BULLET]Grey (Greater Burrower; [LINK=PROMOTION_SPIDER_MUCRO_GREATER]Greater Mucro[\LINK]).[NEWLINE][TAB][ICON_BULLET]Red (Greater Exploder; [LINK=PROMOTION_SPIDER_RHAGODESSA_GREATER]Greater Rhagodessa[\LINK]).[NEWLINE][TAB][ICON_BULLET]Yellow (Greater Weaver; [LINK=PROMOTION_SPIDER_TEXTUS_GREATER]Greater Textus[\LINK]). [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Archosian Giant Spiders can be sacrificed at the capital to create [LINK=BUILDING_ARCHOS_NEST_ADDON1]Broodchambers[\LINK] which powers up future spiders. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Giant Spiders of variant Green and Grey can be further [LINK=SPELL_GIANT_SPIDER_ARCHOS]upgraded[\LINK] to Behemoths once they reach level 8 and the Archosian capital has 16+ population.

TEXT.Spanish: Giant Spiders can evolve along their color variant for even more powerful abilities:[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][TAB][ICON_BULLET]Blue (Greater Diver; [LINK=PROMOTION_SPIDER_ARGYRONETA_GREATER]Greater Argyroneta[\LINK]).[NEWLINE][TAB][ICON_BULLET]Green (Greater Spitter; [LINK=PROMOTION_SPIDER_VENENUM_GREATER]Greater Venenum[\LINK]).[NEWLINE][TAB][ICON_BULLET]Grey (Greater Burrower; [LINK=PROMOTION_SPIDER_MUCRO_GREATER]Greater Mucro[\LINK]).[NEWLINE][TAB][ICON_BULLET]Red (Greater Exploder; [LINK=PROMOTION_SPIDER_RHAGODESSA_GREATER]Greater Rhagodessa[\LINK]).[NEWLINE][TAB][ICON_BULLET]Yellow (Greater Weaver; [LINK=PROMOTION_SPIDER_TEXTUS_GREATER]Greater Textus[\LINK]). [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Archosian Giant Spiders can be sacrificed at the capital to create [LINK=BUILDING_ARCHOS_NEST_ADDON1]Broodchambers[\LINK] which powers up future spiders. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Giant Spiders of variant Green and Grey can be further [LINK=SPELL_GIANT_SPIDER_ARCHOS]upgraded[\LINK] to Behemoths once they reach level 8 and the Archosian capital has 16+ population

TEXT.English: The Archosian Fort Commander UU has roughly the same effectiveness compared to a normal Fort Commander. It has higher initial strength and combat ability (except against recon units), but takes a longer time to unlock its full abilities, and does not have access to the full set of promotions that the Fort Commander does. However, they do gain [LINK=PROMOTION_FORTSPIDER1]Fort Spider I[\LINK] and [LINK=PROMOTION_FORTSPIDER2]Fort Spider II[\LINK] at level 3 and 5 respectively. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]With Fort Spider I, they can turn any fortification into a [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_INFESTED_FORTRESS]Infested Fortress[\LINK] and [LINK=SPELL_SPAWN_BABY_SPIDER]summon a temporary baby spider[\LINK]. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]With Fort Spider II, they gain a ranged attack.

TEXT.English: Archosian Hunters spend weeks in the wilds of Erebus, stalking prey with a spider companion. When it is time to strike, the spider attacks and paralyses the target with venom before the hunter deals the deathblow. The tribe have been living with spiders for so long that the venom in the carcass is no longer deadly to them - though it does take it's toll. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]When a hunting team survives the wilds long enough to become noteworthy, they may be sent further afield to hunt more dangerous prey. The spider becomes more deadly as it grows and the hunter relies on it to a greater degree. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The most successful hunters may find that they develop mutations as they continue to eat the poisoned meat of their kills. This is seen as a "gift" from Mother and a sign that the hunter is favoured. In anycase, many of these mutations prove beneficial in combat and the Spiderkin is practically immune to further poisoning.

Lorsqu'il faut frapper, l'Araign�e attaque et paralyse sa cible avec son venin avant que le Veneur fasse le tir mortel. Le clan a v�cu avec les Araign�es depuis si longtemps que le venin pr�sent dans la carcasse n'est plus mortel pour eux (m�me s'il continue de prendre son d�). [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Quand un bin�me de chasse survit suffisamment longtemps pour �tre remarqu�, ils peuvent �tre envoy�s encore plus loin pour chasser des proies encore plus dangereuses. L'Araign�e devient plus dangereuse � mesure qu'elle grandit et le Reclus compte encore plus sur elle. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Les chasseurs les plus efficaces peuvent d�couvrir qu'ils d�veloppent des mutations tandis qu'ils continuent de manger la viande empoisonn�e de leurs victimes. Elles sont vues comme des "pr�sents" de la M�re et un signe que le chasseur est favoris�. N'importe comment, la plupart de ces mutations se r�v�lent b�n�fiques en combat et l'Arachnomorphe est pratiquement immunis� � tout empoisonnement ult�rieur.
TEXT.German: Archosian Hunters spend weeks in the wilds of Erebus, stalking prey with a spider companion. When it is time to strike, the spider attacks and paralyses the target with venom before the hunter deals the deathblow. The tribe have been living with spiders for so long that the venom in the carcass is no longer deadly to them - though it does take it's toll. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]When a hunting team survives the wilds long enough to become noteworthy, they may be sent further afield to hunt more dangerous prey. The spider becomes more deadly as it grows and the hunter relies on it to a greater degree. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Die erfolgreichsten J�ger m�gen Mutationen an sich bemerken, wenn sie nur kontinuierlich das vergiftete Fleisch ihrer Beute verzehren. Dies wird als ein "Geschenk" von Mutter und als Zeichen ihrer Gunst angesehen. In jedem Fall entpuppen sich viele dieser Mutationen als n�tzlich im Kampf, so sind die Sipplinge der Spinnentiere z.B. praktisch immun gegen weitere Vergiftungen.

TEXT.English: Members of the Archosian tribe survived the harsh winters by learning to source their food from places where others would find unthinkable. The tradition is carried well into the Age of Rebirth.

TEXT.Spanish: Members of the Archosian tribe survived the harsh winters by learning to source their food from places where others would find unthinkable. The tradition is carried well into the Age of Rebirth.

TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET]Sacrifice 10 baby spiders as an extra source of food for the people of the city, at the cost of their health (+4 [ICON_FOOD], +8 [ICON_UNHEALTHY])

TEXT.English: Vangards of the Archosian army are known to bless their weapons with the venom of Mother's young before charging headlong into battle.

TEXT.English: When food is scarce, spiders will not hesitate to feed upon their weaker siblings.

TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET]Consumes a Baby Spider to recover 15% health.
TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET]Consumes a Baby Spider to recover 15% health.
TEXT.German: [ICON_BULLET]Consumes a Baby Spider to recover 15% health.
TEXT.Italian: [ICON_BULLET]Consumes a Baby Spider to recover 15% health.
TEXT.Spanish: [ICON_BULLET]Consumes a Baby Spider to recover 15% health.

TEXT.English: An Archosian feast is also a sacrifice to Mother. A choice portion is prepared, the meat of the thighbones: it is wrapped in a double fold of fat and the outside covered with small pieces of meat from different parts of the animal. Wine is poured over it, a libation, and the eight-legged critters carry it to the goddess below before the sacrificers at last begin their meal.

TEXT.English: In the darkest recesses of the caverns crawled things that are neither spider nor man - and infinitely more terrible than both.
TEXT.French: In the darkest recesses of the caverns crawled things that are neither spider nor man - and infinitely more terrible than both.

TEXT.English: Those most faithful to Mother would offer up even their humanity, and in it place Mother would fill with its spite, its malice... [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]...And it is more horrible than anything the human body could hope to bear.
